tldr: Q3 FY2025 revenue grew 10% to $24.4B with EPS up 14% to $2.15 as AI and traditional servers drove ISG growth. Dell guided Q4 revenue of $24.0B-$25.0B and EPS of $2.50 +/- $0.10, with full-year revenue growth of ~9% and EPS of $7.81.
bullets: Revenue rose 10% to $24.4B and diluted EPS increased 14% to $2.15; ISG revenue grew 34%.
AI orders were $3.6B and shipments were $2.9B, lifting backlog to $4.5B as pipeline grew over 50% sequentially.
Q4 guide: revenue $24.0B-$25.0B and EPS $2.50 +/- $0.10; FY2025 EPS expected at $7.81.

segments.title: Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG)
points: Revenue grew 34% to $11.4B; server and networking revenue rose 58% to $7.4B.
Storage revenue increased 4% to $4.0B with double-digit demand in PowerStore and PowerFlex.
Operating income was $1.5B with margin at 13.3%, up 230 bps sequentially.

segments.title: Client Solutions Group (CSG)
points: Revenue declined 1% to $12.1B; commercial grew 3% while consumer fell 18%.
Operating income was $694M (5.7% margin) as consumer pricing remained pressured.

segments.title: AI servers and pipeline
points: AI orders set a record at $3.6B and shipments totaled $2.9B, with backlog rising to $4.5B.
Five-quarter pipeline grew more than 50% sequentially, led by CSP and enterprise demand.

notes.title: Margin drivers
points: Server mix and cost efficiencies drove ISG margin improvement.
AI server margins were flat to slightly higher sequentially.

notes.title: PC refresh timing
points: Commercial demand held up, but broader refresh pushed into calendar 2025.
Windows 10 end-of-life remains a key catalyst.

themes.title: AI shipment timing
points: Guidance implies Q4 AI shipments down slightly due to Blackwell transition timing.
Pipeline growth reflects expanding enterprise and CSP demand.

themes.title: ISG margin durability
points: Margin gains came from server mix, improved storage pricing, and operating leverage.
Management expects further improvement in Q4.

top_questions.question: Why did full-year revenue guidance move lower despite a strong AI pipeline?
top_questions.summary: PC refresh timing shifted later and AI demand shifted toward Blackwell, affecting near-term shipments.

top_questions.question: Is Q4 AI revenue expected to decline sequentially?
top_questions.summary: Management indicated shipments would be slightly down sequentially based on Blackwell ramp timing.

top_questions.question: How is storage positioned for AI attach?
top_questions.summary: Dell emphasized Dell IP storage, PowerStore and PowerFlex demand, and attach opportunities to AI deployments.

implications: Blackwell transition may create near-term AI shipment volatility but supports longer-term pipeline growth.
ISG margin expansion suggests Dell is capturing higher-value AI services and storage attach.
competitive_notes: Consumer PC pricing remains pressured; enterprise AI margins are structurally higher.
forecast_hooks: Track Q4 AI shipments versus $2.9B Q3 level and backlog growth.
Monitor storage growth relative to server demand to gauge attach rates.

action_items: Validate Blackwell delivery timing with supply chain checks.
Track enterprise AI pipeline conversion and services attach.
open_questions: How quickly will PC refresh accelerate into calendar 2025?
Will storage growth sustain as AI deployments scale?
watch_next_quarter: Q4 ISG margin progression and OpEx reductions.
AI backlog changes around the Blackwell ramp.
